intro: Gomphia racemosa, commonly known as the spike rush, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, thriving in moist to aquatic environments. The plant has slender, grass-like stems that bear clusters of small, spike-like inflorescences. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female structures, and it relies on wind pollination. Gomphia racemosa plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
